a(s/n).description: Returns the last index of `s/n` in `S`, or `-1` if not found.

a(r).description: Returns the index of the last character in `S` that matches `r`, or `-1` if none do.

a(f).description: Returns the index of the last character in `S` to return a truthy value when passed through `f`, or `-1` if none do.

b(s/n).description: Returns the first index of `s/n` in `S`, or `-1` if not found.

b(r).description: Returns the index of the first character in `S` that matches `r`, or `-1` if none do.

b(f).description: Returns the index of the first character in `S` to return a truthy value when passed through `f`, or `-1` if none do.

c(n=0).description: Returns the codepoint of the character in `S` at index `n`.

c(f).description: Returns the result of passing the codepoints of each character in `S` through `f`.

d(s).description: Returns the result of replacing `x` with `y` in `S` for each pair of characters `xy` in `s`.

d(s/n,...,s/n).description: Returns the result of replacing `x` with `y` in `S` for each pair of arguments `x,y`.

e(r/s/n,s/n/a=\"\").description: Returns the result of recursively replacing occurrences of `r/s/n` in `S` with `s/n/a`.

g(n=0).description: Returns the character in `S` at index `n`.

g(f).description: Returns the result of running `S` through `f`.

h(s,n=0).description: Returns the result of replacing the characters starting at index `n` in `S` with `s`. Arguments may be passed in any order.

i(s,n=0).description: Returns the result of inserting `s` in `S` at index `n`. Arguments may be passed in any order.

j(n1,n2=1).description: Returns the result of removing `n2` characters from `S` starting from index `n1`.

k(s/n/a,x?).description: Returns the result of removing all characters in `s/n/a` from `S`. Case-insensitive unless `x` is truthy.

k(f).description: Returns the result of removing all characters from `S` that return a truthy value when passed through `f`.

m(f,s=\"\").description: Returns the result of splitting `S` on `s`, passing each item through `f` and then rejoining with `s`.

n(n=10).description: Returns `S` converted from a base-`n` string to a base-`10` integer. `n` is limited to `2-36`, inclusive.

n(s/a).description: Returns the result of converting `S` from a base-`s/a` string to a base-`10` integer. (e.g., `"baab".n("ab")` = `"1001".n(2)` = `9`)

n(x,x).description: Returns the result of converting `S` from a base-`x1` to a base-`x2` string.

n(x=10,x?,f).description: Returns the result of converting `S` from a base-`x1` string to a base-`10` integer, passing it through `f` and then converting it to a base-`x2` string. If `x2` is not passed then the result will be converted back to the original base.

o(s/n/a,x?).description: Returns the result of removing all characters not in `s/n/a` from `S`. Case-insensitive unless `x` is truthy.

o(f).description: Returns the result of removing all characters from `S` that return a falsey value when passed through `f`.

p(f).description: Returns the result of passing `S` through `f` and appending it to the original `S`.

r(s1,s2/n=\"\",s3=\"g\").description: Returns the result of replacing `s1` with `s2/n` in `S`. [regex:Regular Expression] flags can be passed via parameter `s3`.

r(r,s/n=\"\").description: Returns the result of replacing [regx:`r`] with `s/n` in `S`.

s(n1=0,n2=S.length).description: Returns the result of slicing `S` from index `n1` to `n2`.

t(n1=0,n2=S.length).description: Returns a length `n2` substring of `S` starting from index `n1`.

x(n?).description: Returns `S` with whitespace trimmed. Only trims from the right if `n=1`, or the left if `n=2`.

y().description: Returns the result of splitting `S` on newlines, transposing rows with columns and then rejoining with newlines.

y(f).description: Returns the result of passing each column in `S` through `f`.

z(n=1).description: Returns the result of splitting `S` on newlines, rotating clockwise by `n*90` degrees and then rejoining with newlines.

à(n?).description: Returns all combinations of `S`. If `n` is passed, returns all combinations of length `n`.

á(n?).description: Returns all unique permutations of `S`. If `n` is passed, returns all permutations of length `n`.

â(r/s/n).description: Returns the first index of `r/s/n` in `S`, or `-1` if not found. Moved to `S.b(r)` in [v:2.0a0] (See below)

â().description: Returns the unique characters in `S` in the order they first appear.

ã(n?,s/a?).description: Returns all substrings of `S`. If `n` is passed, returns all substrings of length `n`. Prior to [v:1.4.6] `n` defaults to `2`. If `s/a` is also passed then it is first prepended to the array.

ã(f).description: Returns all substrings of `S` after passing each through `f`.

ä(f,s/a?).description: Returns the result of passing each consecutive pair of characters `x,y` in `S` through `f` with arguments `(x,y,x+y)`. If `s/a` is passed then it is first prepended to the array.

å(f,x=S[0]).description: Returns the result of splitting `S` and cumulatively reducing it by `f` with an initial value of `x`.

ç(s).description: Returns `S` with each character replaced with `s`.

è(r/s/n).description: Returns the number of occurrences of `r/s/n` in `S`.

é(n=1).description: Returns the result of rotating `S` right by `n` characters.

ê(n=0).description: Returns `S` palindromised if `n%2=0`, or the reverse of `S` appended to `S`.

ê(s).description: Returns `true` if `S` is a palindrome, or `false` if it isn't

ë(n1=2,n2=0).description: Returns every `n1`th character of `S` starting from index `n2`.

í(s/a?,f=+).description: Returns the result of pairing each character in `S` with the corresponding character in `s`, or element in `a`, and reducing each pair by `f`. If `s/a` is not passed then indices of the characters in `S` are used instead.

î(s=\" \").description: Returns `s` repeated and sliced to the length of `S`.

ï(s/a=S,f=+).description: Returns the result of pairing each character in `S` with each character in `s`, or element in `a`, and reducing each pair by `f`.

ð(r/s/n,x?).description: Returns the indices of `S` where a match for `r/s/n` begins. Case-sensitive unless `x` is truthy.

ñ(f?).description: Returns the characters of `S` sorted as though they had been passed through `f`.

ò(n=2).description: Returns `S` partitioned into strings of length `n`. If `n` is negative then partitions from the end of `S`

ò(f).description: Returns `S` partitioned between each pair of characters that return a truthy value when passed through `f`.

ó(n=2).description: Returns `S` split into `n` strings each containing every `n`th character of `S`.

ó(f).description: Returns `S` partitioned between each pair of characters that return a falsey value when passed through `f`.

ô(f).description: Returns `S` partitioned at each character that returns a truthy value when passed through `f`.

ö(n=1).description: Returns `n` random characters from `S` with `n` rounded up to the nearest whole number, if necessary.

ø(s/n).description: Returns `true` if `S` contains `s/n`, or `false` if it doesn't.

ø(a).description: Returns `true` if `S` contains any element of `a`, or `false` if it doesn't.

ù(s=\" \",n?).description: Returns the result of left-padding each line in `S` with `s` to length `n`. If `n` is not passed then the length of the longest line is used.

ú(s=\" \",n?).description: Returns the result of right-padding each line in `S` with `s` to length `n`. If `n` is not passed then the length of the longest line is used.

û(s=\" \",n?).description: Returns the result of centre-padding each line in `S` with `s` to length `n`. If `n` is not passed then the length of the longest line is used.
